tit.j: 白河舟田・本沼遺跡群
tit.cmt: タイトルなので大文字にしました。

sen.j: 白河舟田・本沼遺跡群（しらかわふなだ・もとぬまいせきぐん）は、下総塚古墳、谷地久保古墳、舟田中道遺跡で構成されている遺跡群で、福島県白河市北部に位置する。
sen.e: The Shirakawa Funada/Motonuma remains group, located in the northern part of Shiraka City, Fukushima Prefecture, are composed of the Shimousazuka tumulus, the Yajikubo tumulus, and the Funada Nakamichi remains.

The Shirakawa Funada/Motonuma remains group, located in the northern part of Shiraka City, Fukushima Prefecture, are composed of the Shimousazuka tumulus, the Yajikubo tumulus, and the Funada Nakamichi remains.

The Shirakawa Funada/Motonuma remains group, located in the northern part of Shiraka City, Fukushima Prefecture, are composed of the Shimousazuka tumulus, the Yajikubo tumulus, and the Funada Nakamichi remains.

sen.j: 平成17年（2005年）5月に国史跡に指定された。
sen.e: They were designated as national historical sites in May, 2005.
They were designated as national historical sites in May, 2005.
They were designated as national historical sites in May, 2005.

sen.j: 下総塚古墳
sen.e: The Shimousazuka tumulus
The Shimousazuka tumulus
The Shimousazuka tumulus

sen.j: 基壇を有する前方後円墳で、墳長は71メートルである。
sen.e: This is a 71-long keyhole-shaped tumulus with a stylobate.
This is a 71-meter-long keyhole-shaped tumulus with a stylobate.
sen.cmt: ハイフンとmeter補足しました。
sen.e: This is a 71-meter-long keyhole-shaped tumulus with a stylobate.

sen.j: 安山岩で構築された横穴式石室は奥壁から入口まで長さ約7mを測る。
sen.e: Its horizontal stone chamber is constructed using Anzangan rock (andesite), and the length between the entrance and the innermost wall is approx. seven meters.
Its horizontal stone chamber is constructed using Anzangan rock (andesite), and the length between the entrance and the innermost wall is approx. seven meters.
Its horizontal stone chamber is constructed using Anzangan rock (andesite), and the length between the entrance and the innermost wall is approx. seven meters.

sen.j: 円筒埴輪や形象埴輪が出土しているが、配置位置までは不明である。
sen.e: Cylindrical haniwa (unglazed terra-cotta cylinders and hollow sculptures arranged on and around the mounded tombs (kofun)) and keisho haniwa (clay figures in the shape of a human or beast) were unearthed, but it is not known where they were located exactly.

Cylindrical haniwa (unglazed terra-cotta cylinders and hollow sculptures arranged on and around the mounded tombs [kofun]) and keisho haniwa (clay figures in the shape of a human or beast) were unearthed, but it is not known where they were located exactly.
sen.cmt: 括弧内括弧を［］に訂正しました。
sen.e: Cylindrical haniwa (unglazed terra-cotta cylinders and hollow sculptures arranged on and around the mounded tombs [kofun]) and keisho haniwa (clay figures in the shape of a human or beast) were unearthed, but it is not known where they were located exactly.

sen.j: 6世紀後半の築造と推定され、「白河国造」の墓の可能性も考えられる。
sen.e: It is presumed that the tumulus was constructed in the latter half of the six century, and it is also considered that it may be the tomb of a 'Shirakawa no Kuni no Miyatsuko' governor (the governor of the Shirakawa province).

It is presumed that the tumulus was constructed in the latter half of the sixth century, and it is also considered that it may be the tomb of a 'Shirakawa no Kuni no Miyatsuko' governor (the governor of the Shirakawa Province).
sen.cmt: sixthに訂正しました。Province大文字にしました。
sen.e: It is presumed that the tumulus was constructed in the latter half of the sixth century, and it is also considered that it may be the tomb of a 'Shirakawa no Kuni no Miyatsuko' governor (the governor of the Shirakawa Province).

sen.j: 舟田中道遺跡
sen.e: The Funada Nakamichi remains
The Funada Nakamichi remains
The Funada Nakamichi remains

sen.j: 下総塚古墳の北西、標高315メートルほどの河岸段丘上に位置している。
sen.e: The remains are located on an fluvial terrace at 315 meters above sea level, in the northwest of the Shimousazuka tumulus
The remains are located on an fluvial terrace at 315 meters above sea level, in the northwest of the Shimousazuka tumulus.
sen.cmt: ピリオド補足しました。
sen.e: The remains are located on an fluvial terrace at 315 meters above sea level, in the northwest of the Shimousazuka tumulus.

sen.j: 一辺約70メートルの規模をもつ豪族居館の跡で柵列や竪穴住居の跡が見つかっている。
sen.e: This is remains of an approx. 70-m square residence of a gozoku (local ruling family), and remains of wooden fences and of tateanajukyo (pit dwelling houses) were also found there.
sen.cmt: 柵列： "wooden fence"と訳しましたが、定訳は不明です。
sen.e: This is remains of an approx. 70 square meters residence of a gozoku (local ruling family), and remains of wooden fences and of tateanajukyo (pit dwelling houses) were also found there.
This is remains of an approx. 70 square meters residence of a gozoku (local ruling family), and remains of wooden fences and of tateanajukyo (pit dwelling houses) were also found there.

sen.j: 6世紀後半－7世紀前半の遺跡と推定され、下総塚古墳被葬者の次代を担った「白河国造」の居館と考えられる。
sen.e: It is presumed that the residence was used in the era from the latter half of the sixth century to the first half of the seventh century, and it is considered having been resided by the 'Shirakawa no Kuni no Miyatsuko' governor who followed the person buried in the Shimousazuka tumulus.

It is presumed that the residence was used in the era from the latter half of the sixth century to the first half of the seventh century, and it is considered having been resided by the 'Shirakawa no Kuni no Miyatsuko' governor who followed the person buried in the Shimousazuka tumulus.

It is presumed that the residence was used in the era from the latter half of the sixth century to the first half of the seventh century, and it is considered having been resided by the 'Shirakawa no Kuni no Miyatsuko' governor who followed the person buried in the Shimousazuka tumulus.

sen.j: 谷地久保古墳
sen.e: The Yajikubo tumulus
The Yajikubo tumulus
The Yajikubo tumulus

sen.j: 谷地久保古墳は、上記2遺跡から約1.8キロメートル北西の丘陵南斜面に立地し、北・西・東の三方が高く南が低い、「山寄せ」と呼称される立地上の特質をもつ古墳である。
sen.e: The Yajikubo tumulus is located on the south slope of a hill in an approx. 1.8 km northwest of the two remains described above, featuring that it is built in the land shape called 'yamayose' in which its southern part is lower than the north, east and west parts

The Yajikubo tumulus is located on the south slope of a hill in an approx. 1.8 km northwest of the two remains described above, featuring that it is built in the land shape called 'yamayose' in which its southern part is lower than the north, east and west parts.
sen.cmt: ピリオド補足しました。
sen.e: The Yajikubo tumulus is located on the south slope of a hill in an approx. 1.8 km northwest of the two remains described above, featuring that it is built in the land shape called 'yamayose' in which its southern part is lower than the north, east and west parts.

sen.j: 1926年（大正15年）に踏査と石槨の実測がおこなわれた。
sen.e: In 1926, the site was surveyed and the size of the sekkaku (or ishki) (the stone case for a coffin) was measured
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1926, the site was surveyed and the size of the sekkaku (or ishki) (the stone case for a coffin) was measured.
sen.cmt: ピリオド補足しました。
sen.e: In 1926, the site was surveyed and the size of the sekkaku (or ishki) (the stone case for a coffin) was measured.

sen.j: 1983年（昭和58年）には関西大学考古学研究室が石槨の再実測をおこなった。
sen.e: In 1983, the size of the sekkaku was measured by the archaeological research laboratory of Kansai University again.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1983, the size of the sekkaku was measured by the archaeological research laboratory of Kansai University again.
In 1983, the size of the sekkaku was measured by the archaeological research laboratory of Kansai University again.

sen.j: さらに2003年（平成15年）には、白河市教育委員会が内容確認のための発掘調査をおこなった。
sen.e: Furthermore, in 2003, the board of education at Shirakawa City Board of Education excavated the site for checks.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Furthermore, in 2003, the board of education at Shirakawa City Board of Education excavated the site for checks.
Furthermore, in 2003, the board of education at Shirakawa City Board of Education excavated the site for checks.

sen.j: 直径約17メートルの墳丘をもつ円墳で、畿内の横口式石槨との類似が指摘されている。
sen.e: It is a round tumulus with a diameter of approx. 17 meters, and it is pointed out that the sekkaku resembles the one in the Kinai region (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto) whose portion to be opened is provided on a side.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is a round tumulus with a diameter of approx. 17 meters, and it is pointed out that the sekkaku resembles the one in the Kinai region (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto) whose portion to be opened is provided on a side.

It is a round tumulus with a diameter of approx. 17 meters, and it is pointed out that the sekkaku resembles the one in the Kinai region (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto) whose portion to be opened is provided on a side.

sen.j: 山寄せの立地もまた畿内の終末期古墳と共通する。
sen.e: The yamayose gland shape is the same as those of tumuli in the Kinai region in the final era of the kofun period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The yamayose gland shape is the same as those of tumuli in the Kinai region in the final era of the kofun period.
The yamayose gland shape is the same as those of tumuli in the Kinai region in the final era of the kofun period.

sen.j: 遺物の出土は確認されていないものの、年代は石槨の形態から7世紀末葉から8世紀初頭と推定される。
sen.e: Although no relic is found there, it is presumed that from the shape of the sekkan, the tumulus was constructed in the era from towards the end of the seventh century to the early eighth century.
Although no relic is found there, it is presumed that from the shape of the sekkan, the tumulus was constructed in the era from towards the end of the seventh century to the early eighth century.
Although no relic is found there, it is presumed that from the shape of the sekkan, the tumulus was constructed in the era from towards the end of the seventh century to the early eighth century.

tit.e: Related remains in the surrounding area
Related remains in the surrounding area
Related remains in the surrounding area

sen.j: 下総塚古墳の東側に位置する借宿集落は寺院跡（借宿廃寺）がみつかっており、北東約2キロメートルには律令時代の役所跡である関和久官衙遺跡がある。
sen.e: In the Kariyado community on the east side of the Shimousazuka tumulus, the former site of a temple (called Kariyadohai-ji Temple) was found, and at the location in an approx. 5 km north of the Shimousazuka tumulus, the former site of Sekiwagu Kanga, a governmental office in the ritsuryo (codes-based) period, exists.

In the Kariyado community on the east side of the Shimousazuka tumulus, the former site of a temple (called Kariyadohai-ji Temple) was found, and at the location in an approx. 5 km north of the Shimousazuka tumulus, the former site of Sekiwagu Kanga, a governmental office in the ritsuryo (codes-based) period, exists.

In the Kariyado community on the east side of the Shimousazuka tumulus, the former site of a temple (called Kariyadohai-ji Temple) was found, and at the location in an approx. 5 km north of the Shimousazuka tumulus, the former site of Sekiwagu Kanga, a governmental office in the ritsuryo (codes-based) period, exists.

sen.j: 下総塚古墳の北方約5kmには泉崎横穴古墳もあり、これらのことから、白河舟田・本沼遺跡群一帯は古代白河地方の中心地域であったと考えられる。
sen.e: With Izumizaki Yokoana cave graves also existing in an approx. 5 km north of the Shimousazuka tumulus, it is considered that the area of the Shirakawa Funada/Motonuma remains group was the center of the Shirakawa region in ancient times.

With Izumizaki Yokoana cave graves also existing in an approx. 5 km north of the Shimousazuka tumulus, it is considered that the area of the Shirakawa Funada/Motonuma remains group was the center of the Shirakawa region in ancient times.

With Izumizaki Yokoana cave graves also existing in an approx. 5 km north of the Shimousazuka tumulus, it is considered that the area of the Shirakawa Funada/Motonuma remains group was the center of the Shirakawa region in ancient times.

sen.j: また、この阿武隈川沿いには多数の古墳群・遺跡が密集している。
sen.e: Furthermore, many tumuli and remains are concentrated along the Abukuma-gawa River.
Furthermore, many tumuli and remains are concentrated along the Abukuma-gawa River.
Furthermore, many tumuli and remains are concentrated along the Abukuma-gawa River.

sen.j: この地域の古墳に限って見れば、本稿の遺跡以外にも泉崎村の原山１号墳は５世紀末の全長20ｍの前方後円墳である事が確認されている。
sen.e: As far as this area is concerned, in addition to the remains described here, it was also confirmed that the Harayama Ichigo-fun tumulus in the Zumizaki-mura village is a 20-m keyhole-shaped one constructed towards the end of the fifth century.

As far as this area is concerned, in addition to the remains described here, it was also confirmed that the Harayama Ichigo-fun tumulus in the Zumizaki-mura Village is a 20m keyhole-shaped one constructed towards the end of the fifth century.
sen.cmt: Village大文字にしました。ハイフン削除しました。
sen.e: As far as this area is concerned, in addition to the remains described here, it was also confirmed that the Harayama Ichigo-fun tumulus in the Zumizaki-mura Village is a 20m keyhole-shaped one constructed towards the end of the fifth century.

sen.j: また、下流の北東側に隣接して中島村に蝦夷穴横穴墓群が発見されている。
sen.e: Furthermore, Ezoana Yokoanabo cave graves were found in the Nakajima-mura village bordering the northeastern side of the river.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Furthermore, Ezoana Yokoanabo cave graves were found in the Nakajima-mura Village bordering the northeastern side of the river.
sen.cmt: Village大文字にしました。ハイフン削除しました。
sen.e: Furthermore, Ezoana Yokoanabo cave graves were found in the Nakajima-mura Village bordering the northeastern side of the river.

sen.j: その東側対岸の石川町には大壇古墳群・悪戸古墳群そして玉川村の宮前古墳群と拡がっている。
sen.e: In addition, Odan burial tumuli and Akudo tumuli are located in the Ishikawa-cho town on the other (eastern) side of the rive, and Miyamae tumuli in the Tamagawa-mura village.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In addition, Odan burial tumuli and Akudo tumuli are located in the Ishikawa-cho Town on the other (eastern) side of the river, and Miyamae tumuli in the Tamagawa-mura Village.
sen.cmt: Town大文字にしました。riverスペル訂正しました。Village大文字にしました。
sen.e: In addition, Odan burial tumuli and Akudo tumuli are located in the Ishikawa-cho Town on the other (eastern) side of the river, and Miyamae tumuli in the Tamagawa-mura Village.

sen.j: 宮前古墳群から阿武隈川を挟んで西側に拡がるのが矢吹町の鬼穴古墳群・弘法山古墳群と、谷中古墳群などである。
sen.e: Oniana tumuli, Koboyama tumuli, and Yanaka tumuli are located in a wide area in the Yabuki-machi town on the west side of the Miyamae tumuli across the Abukuma-gawa River.
Oniana tumuli, Koboyama tumuli, and Yanaka tumuli are located in a wide area in the Yabuki-machi Town on the west side of the Miyamae tumuli across the Abukuma-gawa River.
Oniana tumuli, Koboyama tumuli, and Yanaka tumuli are located in a wide area in the Yabuki-machi Town on the west side of the Miyamae tumuli across the Abukuma-gawa River.

sen.j: ここまでの区間はおおよそ20㎞程の地域である。
sen.e: The area concerned with the descriptions above covers approx. 20 km along the river.
The area concerned with the descriptions above covers approx. 20 km along the river.
The area concerned with the descriptions above covers approx. 20 km along the river.

sen.j: この他にも発見されている多数の古墳・遺跡が存在する。
sen.e: Many other tumuli and remains have been found in the area as well.
Many other tumuli and remains have been found in the area as well.
Many other tumuli and remains have been found in the area as well.

sen.j: この地域に古墳・遺跡が密集する理由として考察されているのは、これらの地域が古代白河地方の重要な地域であり、有力豪族が多数存在した証であると思われる。
sen.e: For why so many tumuli and remains are concentrated in this area, the following reason is considered: This area was an important one in the Shirakawa area in ancient times and these tumuli and remains constitute the evidence that many powerful gozoku families (local influential families) existed there.

For why so many tumuli and remains are concentrated in this area, the following reason is considered: This area was an important one in the Shirakawa area in ancient times and these tumuli and remains constitute the evidence that many powerful gozoku families (local influential families) existed there.

For why so many tumuli and remains are concentrated in this area, the following reason is considered: This area was an important one in the Shirakawa area in ancient times and these tumuli and remains constitute the evidence that many powerful gozoku families (local influential families) existed there.
